rule: Key words and phrases refer to important or emphasized words or short phrases within the sentence.
input: Travel broadens horizons. Cultures enrich experiences. Adventure awaits everywhere.
validityText:
The input consists of a paragraph of text. Upon analyzing the input, it is clear that it contains three distinct sentences: "Travel broadens horizons." "Cultures enrich experiences." and "Adventure awaits everywhere." This satisfies the specification requirement that the input must contain at least three sentences. Each sentence is complete and ends with a period, indicating proper sentence structure. There is no specification that each sentence has to be particularly long or detailed, just that there need to be at least three sentences present.

No violation.
OK
